prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a hollow center Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a hollow center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. 1. Define the Euler angles as (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector as (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). This will create a coordinate system for the 2D sketch plane. Now, create the 2D sketch on the defined coordinate system. 2. Create a face (face_1) and then create 2 loops on it. For loop_1: 3. Draw line_1 from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). 4. Draw line_2 from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.4554). 5. Draw line_3 from (0.75, 0.4554) to (0.0, 0.4554). 6. Connect line_4 from (0.0, 0.4554) to (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop_1. For loop_2: 7. Draw line_1 from (0.0321, 0.0321) to (0.7179, 0.0321). 8. Draw line_2 from (0.7179, 0.0321) to (0.7179, 0.4232). 9. Draw line_3 from (0.7179, 0.4232) to (0.0321, 0.4232). 10. Connect line_4 from (0.0321, 0.4232) to (0.0321, 0.0321) to close the loop_2. The sketch is completed. Now, scale, transform it into a 3D sketch, and then extrude it. 11. Scale the sketch using the sketch scale factor as 0.75. 12. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. 13. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.2679 units, leaving a hollow center inside the rectangular prism with a height of 0.2679 units, and with no extrusion in the opposite direction. The first part is now complete. Please note that the final dimension of the shape is as follows: Shape: A three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a hollow center. Length: 0.2679 Width: 0.75 Height: 0.75 Confidence: 90%</description>
